definition: brimming with enthusiasm (idiom); full of warmth
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
to overflow/(literary) excessive/old variant of 鎰|镒[yi4]

sentences.english: Richard is an actor who knows how to exuberate .
sentences.chinese: 理查是个知道如何表现得热情洋溢的演员。

sentences.english: The resulting response to the light has not been as effusive as expected.
sentences.chinese: 对于光的回应并不如期盼的热情洋溢。

sentences.english: At the top of the country's film industry, the mood is both bullish and ebullient.
sentences.chinese: 匈牙利电影界的上层，充满了昂扬和热情洋溢的气氛。

sentences.english: Her heart always glows with enthusiasm.
Bill was so passionate about explaining his vision that he was leaping over the campfire.
sentences.chinese: 比尔热情洋溢地解释他的梦想，以至于他跳过了篝火。

sentences.english: Sometimes castor oil can also be used as an ebullient.
sentences.chinese: 有时蓖麻油还可以用作了热情洋溢。

sentences.english: Subsequently, the meeting came to a satisfactory close in the burning music.
sentences.chinese: 随后，此次推广会在热情洋溢的乐曲声中圆满结束。

sentences.english: Followed by a passionate lecture on the enfranchisement of women.
sentences.chinese: 然后就妇女解放问题发表一篇热情洋溢的演讲。

sentences.english: I have the pleasure in replying to your gracious speech of welcome.
sentences.chinese: 我非常愉快的答谢您热情洋溢的欢迎词。

sentences.english: Her face blazed with enthusiasm and happiness.
Mayor Wang Hongju delivered impassioned address on the reception.
sentences.chinese: 市长王鸿举在招待会上发表了热情洋溢的致辞。

sentences.english: The two leaders proposed enthusiastic toasts respectively.
sentences.chinese: 两国元首先后发表了热情洋溢的祝酒辞。

sentences.english: His small, rather piggy eyes glitter with enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 他那双很像猪眼的小眼睛里闪烁着热情洋溢的光芒。

sentences.english: Thank you, Mr. President, for your kind words of welcome.
sentences.chinese: 感谢校长先生热情洋溢的欢迎辞。

sentences.english: In the auditorium, university president Zuhal delivered an enthusiastic welcome speech.
sentences.chinese: 在学校礼堂，祖哈校长发表了热情洋溢的欢迎辞。

sentences.english: Thank you, Mr. President, for your warm welcome.
sentences.chinese: 感谢校长热情洋溢的欢迎辞。

definition: (of a singer etc) excellent in voice and expression (idiom)
full of youthful energy (idiom); vigorous/energetic/a bright spark
in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
to make a speech/to make some remarks
